1.text: Select a small sock without any holes in it.

2.text: Spread a handful of polyester stuffing next to the sock.

3.text: Sprinkle 1 tbsp (0.5 g) of catnip over the stuffing.

4.text: Stuff the polyester all the way into the sock.

5.text: Tie the sock into a knot to close it.

6.text: Sketch the shape of a mouse onto wool felt fabric with chalk.

7.text: Cut the patterns out with sharp fabric scissors.

8.text: Turn the pieces of fabric upside down to build the mouse.

9.text: Lay a 4 in (10 cm) length of yarn over the fabric.

10.text: Use a sewing machine to sew the front and sides closed.

11.text: Turn the fabric inside-out to prepare to finish it.

12.text: Place a handful of polyester stuffing beside the fabric.

13.text: Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon (15 ml) (0.5 g) of catnip onto the stuffing and put it into the mouse.

14.text: Sew the back end of the mouse shut to seal the toy.

15.text: Remove any glue or paper left on a small paper cardboard tube.

16.text: Fold the ends of the rolls halfway in to cover the openings.

17.text: Open one end of the tube to add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) (0.5 g) of catnip to it.

18.text: Close the cardboard tube back up to shut it.

19.text: Decorate the tube by drawing or coloring on it.
